attributes.action: Stop price gouging during a national crisis by having a price cap
attributes.additional_details: The vulnerable people in society are struggling to get essential items and are also forced to pay 10 , 20 , 100 times more for a product which could be their food money for that week . The price cap should apply to all market traders,  retailers , ecommerce traders and social media
attributes.background: Have a price limit on goods when there is a national crisis to stop opportunists buying and selling 1000s of items at massively inflated prices .By capping prices it will stop people making big money and also limit panic buying .

rejection.details:
The Government and Parliament are not responsible for setting prices for consumer goods.

You could start a petition calling for the Government to introduce legislation requiring retailers not to sell certain types of products for more than their Recommended Retail Price.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus
